MultipleChoice.Title: Body and spirit vocabulary
MultipleChoice.Instruction: Click on the word or phrase with the same meaning as the words in italics.

Content.Question:
1. I don’t think there is such a thing as life after death. believe
imagine
know

2. Julie is finding it increasingly difficult to relax at the end of a busy working day. meditate
unwind
pray

3. George is so stressed at the moment that he always seems to be annoyed about something.anxious
worried
bad-tempered

4. What is important when you’re feeling stressed is to detach yourself from the situation for a while.take a step back
take a step forward
step sideways

5. There is nothing better than sitting peacefully with a cool drink and a good book at the end of a day. stressing out
chilling out
working up

6. It really isn’t worth Henry getting so agitated over all the preparations for the office move. worked up
over-worked
under-worked

7. Sally must try to relax and stop feeling so worried about her weight all the time. bad-tempered
worked-up
tense

8. Patrick has let his work problems affect him in a negative way, and now he’s off work with flu. get on with him
get along with him
get on top of him

9. Ivan eats certain foods to maintain the glucose levels in his body. a special diet
a loss of appetite
dairy foods

10. The colour of a room definitely influences Oscar. can make Oscar out of breath
affects Oscar’s mood
can affect Oscar’s appetite
